messages.message:
Hey team, I am getting following error while logging into my local dev environment
```2022/05/09 16:37:34 ERROR utils/db/session/dbsession.go:301 -- Prepare statement failed: ORA-12154: TNS:could not resolve the connect identifier specified
2022/05/09 16:37:34 ERROR accountservice/handler/account.go:134 -- Fail: No registered account found with this email.```
am able to login to dogfood and ib.com (http://ib.com) with same creds, do I need to change DB params locally to adjust service name or SID?
Can you confirm that you restarted all your services, this sounds like there’s a mismatch somewhere
yes @Heymian I did couple of times, I even tried recompiling all modules once, but machine crashed(not that I was expecting it to fix it)
can you also double check your credentials? you should be using the login for dogfood (same database as local). It’s different from instabase.com (http://instabase.com).

somehow my creds at instabase.com (http://instabase.com) and dogfood are same :disappointed:  however, I have been validating them by logging out and logging in couple of times and creds are working...I have made sure to try the same creds locally.....

From the error it seems, since it is not able to connect to the dogfood DB, it fails with generic message of no registered account found with this email, no?
yeah this error likely means that you’re configs are not pointing at the right database, or your credentials are wrong.
what cmd are you running to bring up core platform service?
currently I am just doing >>provisioner.py start lite
i’m guessing that’s bring up core-platform-service in a docker container and not `make build runlocal`.  (i’m not familiar with provisioner). Can you dump in the full logs from core-plaform-service?
ohh, I am so sorry, I started checking out the latest...will do it right away after that. Its too late for you...may be you can take a look tomorrow :slightly_smiling_face:
